SEARCH
Package danogl.util

Class Border

java.lang.Object
danogl.util.Border
public class Border extends Object
Utility class for creating border objects around the window with which GameObjects would collide.
Note: the borders, on their side, are set to collide. For them to stop a game object, it needs to be configured to collide as well using GameObjectPhysics.preventIntersectionsFromDirection(Vector2), e.g. gameObject.physics().preventIntersectionsFromDirection(Vector2.ZERO) .
Author:
Dan Nirel

  • Method Details

    • atDirection

      public static GameObject atDirection(Vector2 dir, Vector2 windowDimensions, float frameWidth, Color color)
      Create a border. This border is not added to the GameObjectCollection and should be added by the user, probably to the layer Layer.STATIC_OBJECTS.
      Note: the created border is in the default coordinate space - world space. You can change this using the returned object's setCoordinateSpace method.
      Parameters:
      dir - one of the four cordinal directions: Vector2.UP, Vector2.DOWN, Vector2.LEFT, or Vector2.RIGHT
      windowDimensions - as returned by windowController.windowDimensions()
      frameWidth - positive values will cause the border to enter the frame by this amount. Negative values will cause the border to be outside the window's frame by this amount.
      color - the border's color if desired, null if the border should be invisible
      Returns:
      a GameObject representing the border. This object should be added to the game's GameObjectCollection at the desired layer, probably Layer.STATIC_OBJECTS.

    • addCompleteFrame

      public static GameObject[] addCompleteFrame(Vector2 windowDimensions, float frameWidth, Color color, GameObjectCollection gameObjects, int layer)
      Add all four borders to the GameObjectCollection in the specified layer
      Parameters:
      windowDimensions - as returned by windowController.windowDimensions()
      frameWidth - positive values will cause the border to enter the frame by this amount. Negative values will cause the border to be outside the window's frame by this amount.
      color - the border's color if desired, null if the border should be invisible
      gameObjects - the game's GameObjectCollection, to which the borders should be added
      layer - the layer in which to add the borders
      Returns:
      an array of 4 GameObjects, corresponding to the borders in the directions up, down, left, and right (in this order)
